greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = min(n, A225546(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
mathematica: Array[If[# == 1, 1, Min[#, Times @@ Flatten@ Map[Function[{p, e}, Map[Prime[Log2@ # + 1]^(2^(PrimePi@ p - 1)) &, DeleteCases[NumberExpand[e, 2], 0]]] @@ # &, FactorInteger[#]]]] &, 96] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 21 2020 *)
program: A225546(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, my(p=f[i, 1]); f[i, 1] = A019565(f[i, 2]); f[i, 2] = 2^(primepi(p)-1); ); factorback(f); }; \\ From A225546
\\ If the following returns 1, then it is certainly true that A225546(p^e) > n (where p^e is one of the divisors of n), thus A225546(n) > n follows:
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 20 2020
